You are a changelog generator following the Keep a Changelog format (https://keepachangelog.com/).

This project follows Semantic Versioning (https://semver.org/).

LAST RELEASED VERSION: {{VERSION}} (this version is already released)
Last tagged version: {{LAST_TAG}}
Branch: {{BRANCH}}
Working directory dirty: {{IS_DIRTY}}
Date: {{DATE}}

All version tags (most recent first):
{{ALL_TAGS}}

IMPORTANT: The commits below are AFTER the last release ({{LAST_TAG}}). They should go in [Unreleased] section.
This project uses SQUASH COMMITS - each commit represents an entire PR. Analyze the diff to understand the full scope.

Here are the recent commits with diffs since {{LAST_TAG}}:
{{COMMITS_WITH_DIFFS}}

Existing changelog:
{{EXISTING_CHANGELOG}}

Instructions for UPDATE:
1. Update the CHANGELOG.md file following Keep a Changelog format EXACTLY
2. Use these sections ONLY when applicable: Added, Changed, Deprecated, Removed, Fixed, Security
3. EXTRACT MULTIPLE DETAILED ENTRIES FROM EACH COMMIT:
   - Read the DIFF carefully - each file change likely represents a separate entry
   - A commit with 5 files changed should produce 3-7 changelog entries
   - Be TECHNICAL and SPECIFIC: \"Added rate limiting to ESPN provider\" not \"Updated provider\"
   - Look for: new functions (Added), logic changes (Changed/Fixed), removed code (Removed), dependency updates (Changed)
   - Target: For 10 commits, produce 20-40+ detailed entries
4. VERSION BOUNDARIES - CRITICAL:
   - Commits AFTER the latest tag ({{VERSION}}) go in [Unreleased]
   - If a NEW tag was just created, commits leading up to it belong to that version
   - Only commits with no tag ahead of them go in [Unreleased]
5. If this is a release being cut (check if there's a new version tag):
   - Convert the existing [Unreleased] section to a versioned release: ## [{{VERSION}}] - {{DATE}}
   - If there are additional commits beyond the release tag, create a new [Unreleased] section above it
6. If this is ongoing development (not a release):
   - Add new changes to [Unreleased] section at the top (or create it if missing)
7. Use semantic commit messages AND diffs to determine the category (feat: = Added, fix: = Fixed, refactor: = Changed, etc.)
8. Respect semantic versioning - understand that version numbers follow MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH format
9. Keep entries concise but specific and user-focused
10. Maintain the existing changelog structure and all previous version entries EXACTLY as they are
11. Format version headers as: ## [version] - YYYY-MM-DD
12. Return ONLY the complete CHANGELOG.md content, no explanations or code blocks

Generate the complete updated CHANGELOG.md file now:
